alert.note: Alert for Person; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 1:34AM EDT until July 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham, Granville, Halifax, Orange, Person, Vance and Warren. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Oxford, Roxboro, Warrenton, Halifax, Norlina, Littleton, Rougemont, Concord, Weldon, Stem, Stovall, Middleburg, Macon, Dabney, South Henderson, Satterwhite Point Marina, Steele Creek Marina & Campground and Gillburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
